text: days after a convincing straight-sets
loss at the US Open and despite a
two-thousand-dollar fine at a public
apology Serena Williams continues to be
the object of ridicule so what is it
about her behavior during the US Open
Championship match that continues to
attract so much resentment Serena
Williams once again crossed the boundary
of what's considered proper and fitting
for female athlete about five decades
ago Althea gifts another great tennis
champion was humiliated when her
womanhood and femininity were called
into question because she was so
athletic and played so aggressively and
she never ever threw a tantrum the fact
is that there is no precedent for the
competitive fire the Serena brings to
the women's tour which is why the only
two players were behavior is
consistently compared to her men Jimmy
Connors and John McEnroe Kotter's and
McEnroe were famous for their explosions
and tantrums on the court but then and
even now those tantrums and explosions
are dismissed as champions being
champions boys being boys in fact
McEnroe's tantrums are celebrated in a
series of commercials meanwhile Serena
is harshly criticized for her actions
because her behavior and her competitive
fire crossed the line and violate was
considered to be respectable behavior
for women not only on the court but also
in the boardroom those of those who have
daughters see this day in day out and
sometimes we see it in our own behavior
criticize Serena for being a sore loser
or criticize her for being ill-tempered
but when you do look into your hearts
when you consider what it is about her
behavior that makes you feel so
uncomfortable perhaps it's because she
violates your own no fly rule
